Text.Page: Hopefully Vella can regain her strength quickly.

While you wait with Hasmina for Vella to regenerate and the teleportal to be repaired, you chat to Hasmina and get to know her better.

Hasmina opens up and tells you about her older twin sister Hellen.

I hope it's not bad news for Vella, even though her body temperature was so low.

Let's take the destroyed teleportal to the Mysterium.

Vella said you'd bring us the teleportal?

Hmm, it won't be easy to fully restore the teleportal, but I'll do my best.

Hang on a minute.

Thank you for saving me.

I was dressed appropriately, but it was much colder in Frost Reach than I'd expected. A moment later and I'd have been done for.

Thank you."What happened?"

I'm guessing you know Dakuryon has several depots?

After I received the Federation's order to find Dakuryon, I searched for one of his locked storehouses. While doing so, I heard that he wanted to establish a new base in Westonia.

I searched high and low in Frost Reach and came across a suspicious teleportal.

When I touched it, the teleportal broke into pieces and I passed out from incredible pain."Pain?"

At first I thought the energy of the destroyed magic stone had caused the pain. However, the sorcerer who treated me said he had found a glyph on my body.

The glyph is different from the ones Dakuryon uses to control the Demokrons.

But no one knows this glyph yet, so we aren't sure who made it or what purpose it serves.

What happened to the teleportal anyway?"It's being repaired as we speak."

Okay.

Then we should wait until the teleportal has been fixed.

The teleportal has been repaired but, oddly, it can't be activated.

The glyph on Vella's body appears to be the power that was keeping the teleportal active.

If you decipher the glyph, we'll be able to find out the teleportal's destination.

One person should return the teleportal to its original location, while the others wait until the glyph is deciphered.

I will return the teleportal to Frost Reach.

Please wait here with Hasmina until you've found a way to activate the teleportal, then follow me.

It's bound to take longer to decipher the glyph than to repair the teleportal. Why don't you take a little break?

Fancy some fresh air?

The air is very pleasant today.

Allemantheia is always a wonderful sight.

Will you walk with me this way a little?

Hellen! Oh my goodness, Hellen?

I heard you died fighting the Argons, but I never believed it.

There was no way an excellent sorcerer like you could meet her end in battle against Argons.

I knew you were still alive!"Her name is Hasmina, not Hellen."

Hasmina?

I'm sorry.

My apologies please.

You look so like Hellen. I got you mixed up.

Hellen is my older twin sister. She was an eminent sorcerer in Allemantheia.

During the Argon War, she set out to research the Argons, but she disappeared without a trace. Later, a scrap of her clothing was found.

Sorcerers are able to sense the magic of other sorcerers, even if they are far away. But no one could sense her magic.

So it was concluded that she had died in battle with the Argons.

I never thought I'd lose my parents, then my sister to the Argon."Is everything alright?"

All these events took their toll on me.

Time has healed some wounds, but I still feel sad when I think of her.

There's just so much here in Allemantheia that reminds me of her.

There's a secret spot near the elevator up ahead where I used to hide when I wanted some time alone after an argument with my sister.You listen in silence.

Oh, I just thought of somewhere.

Will you go there with me?

It's the place my sister and I liked best.

The fountain alone is amazing, but the sound of trickling water always made me feel good.

It was fun watching the people of Allemantheia come through the gate, too."You got on really well with your sister."

Yeah.

Hellen was the reason I came to Allemantheia and became a warrior.

The sorcerers in Allemantheia saw my sister's potential and urged her to come here, but she said she would only come if I came with her.

She was the only thing I had left in this world... and now I'm all alone.
